content.question: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></math>-test for a population proportion will be conducted using a simple random sample selected without replacement from a population. Which of the following is a check for independence?

choices.label: <math alttext="n times p sub 0 is greater than or equal to 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≥</mo><mtext>10</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="n times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p sub 0, close parenthesis, is greater than or equal to 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>(</mo><mtext>1</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo><mo>≥</mo><mtext>10</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for sample size <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and population proportion <math alttext="p sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>.
Each sample proportion value is less than or equal to 0.5.
The sample size is more than 10 times the population size.
The population size is more than 10 times the sample size.
The population distribution is approximately normal.

content.answer: The population size is more than 10 times the sample size.

topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Verify that inference procedures apply in a given situation.
